variants.Description in input context: E146K mutation in DJ-1 (PARK7) associated with Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: Experiments conducted using HEK293 and SH-SY5Y cell lines expressing DJ-1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced DJ-1 protein stability and enzymatic activity in HEK293 cells expressing E146K variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments repeated in three independent biological replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1-expressing cells used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test for multiple comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: DJ-1 protein expression ≥ 80% of wild-type control

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: DJ-1 protein expression < 50% of wild-type control

Material used.Description: Cell viability measured in SH-SY5Y cells expressing E146K variant under oxidative stress.

Readout description.Result Description: E146K-expressing cells showed 40% reduced viability compared to wild-type under H2O2 treatment.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments repeated in three independent biological replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SH-SY5Y cells used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated cells used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test for comparing treatment vs control groups.

Material used.Description: Behavioral and pathological analysis of DJ-1 E146K transgenic mice.

Readout description.Result Description: E146K mice exhibited 30% increased dopaminergic neuron loss and 50% reduced locomotor activity compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments conducted on 15 mice per group (wild-type and E146K).

Technical replicates.Description: Each behavioral test repeated three times per mouse.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type littermates used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated wild-type mice used as negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Dopaminergic neuron loss ≤ 15%, locomotor activity ≥ 80% of wild-type

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Dopaminergic neuron loss > 25%, locomotor activity < 60% of wild-type
